Line 118: Line 118:
; Voice based features: Google search through voice has been available since initial release.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://developer.android.com/resources/articles/speech-input.html | title=Speech Input for Google Search | work=Android Developers | accessdate=3 November 2010}}</ref> Voice actions for calling, texting, navigation, etc. are supported on Android 2.2 onwards.<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.google.com/mobile/voice-actions/ | title=Voice Actions for Android | work=google.com | accessdate=27 January 2011 }}</ref>
; Voice based features: Google search through voice has been available since initial release.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://developer.android.com/resources/articles/speech-input.html | title=Speech Input for Google Search | work=Android Developers | accessdate=3 November 2010}}</ref> Voice actions for calling, texting, navigation, etc. are supported on Android 2.2 onwards.<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.google.com/mobile/voice-actions/ | title=Voice Actions for Android | work=google.com | accessdate=27 January 2011 }}</ref>
; Tethering: Android supports [[tethering]], which allows a phone to be used as a wireless/wired [[Wi-Fi hotspot]]. Before Android 2.2 this was supported by third-party applications or manufacturer customizations.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/190265/use_your_android_phone_as_a_wireless_modem.html | title=Use Your Android Phone as a Wireless Modem | publisher=PCWorld | author=JR Raphael | date=6 May 2010 | accessdate=3 November 2010}}</ref>
; Tethering: Android supports [[tethering]], which allows a phone to be used as a wireless/wired [[Wi-Fi hotspot]]. Before Android 2.2 this was supported by third-party applications or manufacturer customizations.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/190265/use_your_android_phone_as_a_wireless_modem.html | title=Use Your Android Phone as a Wireless Modem | publisher=PCWorld | author=JR Raphael | date=6 May 2010 | accessdate=3 November 2010}}</ref>
â
; Screen capture: Android has native support for [[screenshot]] capture ability by pressing the power and volume buttons at the same time on an Android device. This native support came about with the release of Android's [[Android_version_history#4.0|4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)]] update which is first seen on the [[Google Galaxy Nexus|Galaxy Nexus]] smartphone.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/242128/samsung_google_unveil_latest_android_os_phone.html | title=Samsung, Google Unveil Latest Android OS, Phone | publisher=PCWorld | author=Nancy Gohring | date=19 October 2011 | accessdate=19 October 2011}}</ref> Previously Android did not feature native support for screen capturing which would have likely been due to security concerns. Furthermore previously, manufacturer and third-party customizations as well as using a PC connection (DDMS developer's tool) were the only known methods of capturing a screenshot on Android.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.androidsim.net/2011/06/how-to-25-taking-screen-shots-on.html | title=Taking Screen Shots On The Android | publisher=AndroidSim | author=T. Le | date=27 June 2011 | accessdate=28 June 2011}}</ref>
+
; Screen capture: Android has native support for [[screenshot]] capture ability by pressing the power and volume buttons at the same time on an Android device. This native support came about with the release of Android's [[Android_version_history#4.0|4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)]] update which is first seen on the [[Galaxy Nexus]] smartphone.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/242128/samsung_google_unveil_latest_android_os_phone.html | title=Samsung, Google Unveil Latest Android OS, Phone | publisher=PCWorld | author=Nancy Gohring | date=19 October 2011 | accessdate=19 October 2011}}</ref> Previously Android did not feature native support for screen capturing which would have likely been due to security concerns. Furthermore previously, manufacturer and third-party customizations as well as using a PC connection (DDMS developer's tool) were the only known methods of capturing a screenshot on Android.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.androidsim.net/2011/06/how-to-25-taking-screen-shots-on.html | title=Taking Screen Shots On The Android | publisher=AndroidSim | author=T. Le | date=27 June 2011 | accessdate=28 June 2011}}</ref>
